Gastrointestinal symptom reports

Male, 60 - 75 years

Age Reported Symptoms Notes
60 2021-01-05 nausea Tiredness; nausea; headache; chills; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable Other HCP, the ... Read more
Close
Tiredness; nausea; headache; chills; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable Other HCP, the patient. A 60-year-old male patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE), via an unspecified route of administration on 26Dec2020 at 13:30 (at the age of 60-years-old) as a single dose in the left arm for COVID-19 vaccination. Medical history included migraine. Prior to the vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Concomitant medications included omeprazole, montelukast, and vitamin D3, all for unknown indications from unknown dates and unknown if ongoing. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within four weeks prior to the vaccination. On 30Dec2020 at 08:00, the patient experienced tiredness, nausea, headache, and chills. The patient did not receive any treatment for the events. The clinical outcome of the tiredness, nausea, headache, and chills was not recovered. It was also reported that since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. The lot number for the vaccine, BNT162B2, was not provided and will be requested during follow up.
60 2021-01-05 vomiting DIZZY , VOMITING, SWEATING 15 MIN AFTER VACINATION LASTED 5 MIN THEN 2 -3 HOURS OF CHILLS
60 2021-01-07 abdominal discomfort Approximately 11:00 am I got crazy chills, put on my coat, and turned a heat lamp on, this lasted ab... Read more
Close
Approximately 11:00 am I got crazy chills, put on my coat, and turned a heat lamp on, this lasted about 30 minutes. After the chills my mind went in to a fog, found it very hard to concentrate, and felt like I was moving in slow motion. Also had some GI upset, but discharge. The fog lasted until 4:00 pm.

Close
Dizziness, Nausea Vomiting, Tachycardia, epigastric pain and off; Narrative: advised to see his doctor regarding the abnormal ECG[NONSPECIFIC ST-T CHANGES] in view of the epigastric pain;
60 2021-01-09 nausea body aches, injection site soreness, joint stiffness, nausea, head ache, flu like symptoms

60 2021-01-14 abdominal pain upper The night of the vaccination I became ill with flu-like symptoms. I experienced muscle aches, chills... Read more
Close
The night of the vaccination I became ill with flu-like symptoms. I experienced muscle aches, chills, a fever, fatigue, and stomach cramping that lasted 3 days.
60 2021-01-15 nausea Severe Nausea experienced 8 hours after the IM injection Treated with Zofran, Omeprazole, Diphenhydr... Read more
Close
Severe Nausea experienced 8 hours after the IM injection Treated with Zofran, Omeprazole, Diphenhydramine and Pepto-Bismol
60 2021-01-18 nausea Patient was vaccinated for SARS-CoV-2 on 6-Jan-21 at his site of employment, a Nursing Home. Patient... Read more
Close
Patient was vaccinated for SARS-CoV-2 on 6-Jan-21 at his site of employment, a Nursing Home. Patient presented to Urgent Care on 15-Jan-21 complaining of left sided chest pain that started the evening before with an associated slight cough. Pt was afebrile with a heart rate of 88 and an O2 sat on room air of 98% in triage. His EKG showed a sinus tachycardia of 114 with a slightly prolonged QTc of 463 ms. Physical exam was significant for bibasilar crackles and X-ray showed bibasilar infiltrates consistent with COVID pneumonia but bacterial pneumonia could not be excluded. The patients BP was documented as 97/64. He was treated with Zofran for nausea and tylenol. He was prescribed a five day course of Azithromycin, an Albuterol inhaler, guaifenessin with codeine cough syrup, and Zofran. Labs were drawn and he was discharged. His lab results were reported after his departure and were significant for a white blood cell count of 1.33, platelet count of 73, 2% myelocytes, 1% metamyelocytes, an absolute neutrophil count of 0.75 K/ul, a creatinine of 1.83, total bilirubin of 1.3, with direct bilirubin of 0.8, alkaline phosphatase of 294 and AST of 112 with ALT noted to be within normal limit. His COVID nasopharyngeal swab from the visit was reported as negative and a swab performed at his employment on 13-Jan-21 was also reported to be negative. Patient could not be reached by phone after discharge from Urgent Care about these labs. On the evening of 16-Jan-21, Police Department received a 911 call about an adult at the patient's address who was found unresponsive. Upon arrival on scene, the patient was found to be deceased and a decision was made not to attempt to resuscitate. The death was deemed to be non-suspicious and the patient's body was transported to a funeral home. On 19-Jan-21, I contacted the State Medical Examiner's Office. They have decided to perform an autopsy and have recovered the CBC and chemistry specimens obtained for further testing.
60 2021-01-19 abdominal pain lower Lower abdominal pain consistent with colitis flair >7 days duration. Treated with ibuprofen and heat... Read more
Close
Lower abdominal pain consistent with colitis flair >7 days duration. Treated with ibuprofen and heating pad. Pain continues at 2-3/10.
60 2021-01-20 abdominal pain, diarrhea Abd pain, diarrhea, HA

Close
1/19 2300- INJECTION SITE DISCOMFORT 1/20 0100- FEELING OF FEVER, BODY ACHES, SORE THROAT 0830- NAUSEA, FATIGUE 1050- TEMP 100.4. TOOK TYLENOL 1000MG @ 0100 AND @1030
60 2021-01-22 nausea Shakes headache nausea sweats for 7 days weight loss
60 2021-01-23 decreased appetite Patient experienced fever 103 degrees, body and muscle aches, chills, ringing in the ears, headache... Read more
Close
Patient experienced fever 103 degrees, body and muscle aches, chills, ringing in the ears, headache, loss of appetite. Dr. suggested Tylenol and fluids for treatment. Spent 24 hours in bed as I had no energy.

Close
Received vaccine at 10:44am. My arm was a little sore almost immediately. Approximately 12:30-1:00pm, I started getting a bit nauseated, pit in my stomach . Lasted until went to bed around 9:00pm. In morning felt fine except my arm felt much more sore at the shot point for about 2-3 hours after I woke up. 10:00am everything is normal.

60 2021-02-05 diarrhea I got diarrhea after in about 8 hrs.

I had a really severe left shoulder ache. I couldn't lay on that side, and I had general body aches and a low grade fever. Some nauseous. Really vivid dreams.
60 2021-02-21 diarrhea Diarrhea; body aches; chills; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer. A 60-year-ol... Read more
Close
Diarrhea; body aches; chills; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer. A 60-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Solution for injection, Lot number: EL9262, Expiry date: unknown) via an unspecified route of administration on 29Jan2021 at single dose for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included covid-19 (if covid prior vaccination Yes). The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. The patient experienced diarrhea, body aches and chills on 29Jan2021. It was unknown if the patient receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. No treatment was received for the adverse events. The patient was diagnosed with COVID-19 prior to vaccination. Since the vaccination, the patient has not been tested for COVID-19. The outcome of the events was recovered in Jan2021. No follow-up attempts needed. No further information expected.
60 2021-02-23 abdominal discomfort, diarrhea Upset stomach, headache, severe entire body aches short of breath, diarrhea, chest pressure, chills,... Read more
Close
Upset stomach, headache, severe entire body aches short of breath, diarrhea, chest pressure, chills, fever and body weakness. Talk to Dr. and she recommended to drink plenty of fluids, take Tylenol , and rest.

Close
Phizer-BioNtech COVID-19 Vaccine EUA. Mild, sore throat for a 30 minute period; then dizziness; then nausea /vomiting, chills; T36.2-36.7 celsius. Lasted from 6:00 pm on 2/25/21 to 3:30 am on 2/26/21.
60 2021-03-02 nausea Dizziness, anxiety, nausea. BP 111/74 (pulse 73), 93% O2 sat. Stable.
60 2021-03-04 nausea Pt received Pfizer vaccine at 2:30pm. At 2:35 patient began feeling chest heaviness and nausea. Pt v... Read more
Close
Pt received Pfizer vaccine at 2:30pm. At 2:35 patient began feeling chest heaviness and nausea. Pt vitals taken: BP 150/90, HR 87, O2 97, respirations 18. Pt sent to EMS and given 324mg aspirin, vitals: NP 172/108, HR 92, O2 97% RA, resp. 18. EMS gave 0.4mg nitrogycerin PO x1. Chest heaviness resolved with nitro. Pt recommended to go to hospital for ER evaluation. Pt agreed. Pt transported via ambulance to hospital.
60 2021-03-04 nausea headache, "feels like something in throat" nauseous. Evaluated by EMS- Cleared

Close
12-14 HOURS AFTER RECEIVING THE VACCINE PATIENT REPORTS HE DEVELOPED HEADACHE, MUSCLE ACHES, CHILLS, SWEATS, LOSS OF APPETITE. HE ALSO NOTED A RASH ON HIS NECK, FIRST ON THE NECK AND NOW HAS SPREAD TO THE ENTIRE BODY. PATIENT ALSO REPORTS SHORTNESS OF BREATH WHEN LAYING FLAT ON HIS BACK THAT STARTED AT THE SAME TIME.
60 2021-03-07 diarrhea diarrhea; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 60-year-old male pa... Read more
Close
diarrhea; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 60-year-old male patient, who was also 60-year-old at the time of vaccination, received first dose of bnt162b2 (BNT162B2), lot number not reported, via an unspecified route of administration on left arm from 15Jan2021 14:00 as dose for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient medical history was not reported. There were no concomitant medications. The patient received second dose of BNT162B2 on 05Feb2021 at 02:00 PM on left arm. On 18Jan2021 10:00, patient experienced diarrhea with outcome of not recovered. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of diarrhea which includes Imodium. Information regarding the lot/batch number has been requested.
60 2021-03-11 nausea, diarrhea Starting Monday March 1st approximately 25 hrs after my injection I started feeling slightly nauseou... Read more
Close
Starting Monday March 1st approximately 25 hrs after my injection I started feeling slightly nauseous , and had a loose stool, diarrhea, The following morning I had 2 of the same bowel movements. That continued for a week, until March 9. I would only go in the morning, not all day. The nausea went away after the first day. On Thursday of the week, I took a 1/2 pill of Imodium, On Friday I took another half pill, On the Saturday I took a whole pill. On the Sunday I took 1 pill in the morning and one in early evening. I called my Doctor on Monday March 8th to discuss, he suggested I continue taking Imodium, no more than 2 a day for the next 3-4 days, and to call if I was still experiencing the diarrhea after then. I took 2 pills on the Tuesday, then Wednesday I didn't have a bowel movement , and finall on the Wednesday March 10th I was back to normal... I am not sure if this was caused by vaccine or not, but felt like I should report it.

Close
Escalated temperature in a range of 99.9 to 100.7 over a 19 hour period of time. Extreme fatigue - During a 34 hour period beginning 6 hours after receiving vaccination, I slept approximately 30 hours Diarrhea lasting fewer than 4 hours

Diarrhea began about 4:30 pm on 3/1/2021, continued intermittently for 4-5 hours. Significant loss of energy and headache began around 8:00 pm on 3/1/2021, and persisted with gradually decreasing intensity until 3/5/2021.

60 2021-03-17 nausea Loss of Balance - unsteady - stagger - dizzy. Is more severe with motion - head up, down, standing u... Read more
Close
Loss of Balance - unsteady - stagger - dizzy. Is more severe with motion - head up, down, standing up, bending, walking. -- not severe when not in motion - sitting-lying. Nausea when symptoms started but have subsided since the first full day. Some blurry vision at times and ear ringing - not constant. Does pass but continues with motion. Does not have a time frame as it is continuous when in Up-Down-Bending-etc - motion
60 2021-03-18 abdominal pain, GERD 10 hours after vaccine administered. Started with cloudy vision and a headache. Went to bed. Awoke t... Read more
Close
10 hours after vaccine administered. Started with cloudy vision and a headache. Went to bed. Awoke two hours later with a fever of 102 and severe chills. That lasted 6 hours. Body temp went down to normal. Ate a little breakfast. Tired and achy. Went back to bed. Awoke several hours later. Fever was back. Though not as high, 100. Entire body hurt. Joints, head, abdominal pain, pain in left armpit. Stayed for several hours. Went back to bed about 4:00PM woke up an hour later fever down to 99. Ate a little supper. Acid reflux uncontrollable. Went back to bed. Awoke at 8:00PM . Fever still at 99. Stayed awake until 10:30. Went to bed. Tossed and turned with body aches all night. Had to get up every two hours to urinate. Awoke at 7:30AM. No fever. Feeling somewhat better. Still pain in left armpit. Headache almost gone. Joint pain almost gone, abdominal pain still present. Worst is over.
60 2021-03-18 nausea, retching Patient felt nausea and started dry heaving. He was sweating profusely and had tremors. BP 140/60,... Read more
Close
Patient felt nausea and started dry heaving. He was sweating profusely and had tremors. BP 140/60, HR54, O2 sat 98. He stated that he had not had a meal today and it could be his sugar. His glucose was evaluated and was normal. Pt. was taken to NWMC and was accompanied by his wife.
60 2021-03-18 vomiting, nausea Sweating When Veteran returned to receive his 2nd Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine on 3/15/21, he reported th... Read more
Close
Sweating When Veteran returned to receive his 2nd Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine on 3/15/21, he reported that he had a mild reaction on the day of his first vaccine (2/23/21). Approximately 15 minutes after the vaccine, he experienced sweating, nausea, and one episode of vomiting. After drinking some water, the symptoms self-resolved within 3-5 minutes.
60 2021-03-20 abdominal pain upper Headache, chills, stomach cramps
60 2021-03-20 difficulty swallowing Patient complained of headache and throat itching and difficulty swallowing.
60 2021-03-21 appendicitis Acute appendicitis; This is a spontaneous report from a non-contactable physician (patient). A 60-ye... Read more
Close
Acute appendicitis; This is a spontaneous report from a non-contactable physician (patient). A 60-year-old male patient received first dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, solution for injection, lot: EH9899), via an unspecified route of administration in left arm on 17Dec2020 (at the age of 60-years-old) as single dose for covid-19 immunisation. The patient received the vaccine in a hospital. The patient's medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. On 22Dec2020, the patient experienced acute appendicitis which resulted in doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit, Emergency room/department or urgent care. The patient had appendectomy as treatment. The patient had no other vaccine in four weeks, no Covid prior vaccination and was not Covid tested post vaccination. The outcome of the event was recovered on an unspecified date. No follow-up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.; Sender's Comments: The event appendicitis is likely an intercurrent medical condition and unrelated to suspect drug BNT162B2. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to RAs, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.
60 2021-03-21 nausea "flu-like" started 03/20/21 in the afternoon. Has had nausea, tiredness, headache, bodyaches that ... Read more
Close
"flu-like" started 03/20/21 in the afternoon. Has had nausea, tiredness, headache, bodyaches that continue through 03/22/21. Called his own PCP who told him to call the Health Department.
60 2021-03-22 abdominal pain upper, nausea Arm pain first day. Lightheaded, feeling like fainting, dizziness, above stomach pain nausea, that h... Read more
Close
Arm pain first day. Lightheaded, feeling like fainting, dizziness, above stomach pain nausea, that happened parallel to erratic high blood pressure, 199/98. Chills, shakes, joints and muscle pain, headache, palpitations, night sweats, severe fatigue. From day 3 to day 17. Went to healthcare facility twice, and two doctor calls.
60 2021-03-23 difficulty swallowing Runny nose, sensation of throat closing up, difficulty swallowing. I could continue breathing nasal... Read more
Close
Runny nose, sensation of throat closing up, difficulty swallowing. I could continue breathing nasally and could also drink water. Event cleared up around 6:00 PM the same day (date of vaccination).

Close
12 hours later belly cramps. 24 hours later shortness of breath. Still can't take more than a few steps without getting out of breath.
60 2021-03-24 decreased appetite Rapid heartbeat (90-115bpm) for 2-3 days while laying in bed. Low pulse ox (88) Fever (101-102F) and... Read more
Close
Rapid heartbeat (90-115bpm) for 2-3 days while laying in bed. Low pulse ox (88) Fever (101-102F) and chills Related difficulty urinating and frequent urination due to prostate inflammation Loss of memory (Brain Fog?) in which I had no memory of events occurring from 3/7-3/9 and little memory on 3/10. Memory was close to normal on 3/12. Two Covid tests with negative results (taken on 3/8 and 3/11) Some lung congestion which could be due to bloody sinus mucus and post nasal drip I did retain my sense of smell and taste but had no appetite and did not eat or ate very minimally from 3/7pm until 3/11pm Very fatigued and weak with knee, hip and general joint pain. Increasing levels of fatigue started on 3/2 with little energy from 3/7-3/11. Fatigue is mostly gone as of 3/23.

60 2021-03-27 painful swallowing Severe neck pain on left side on first day of reaction followed by painful swallowing on left side t... Read more
Close
Severe neck pain on left side on first day of reaction followed by painful swallowing on left side the next day. Both conditions persisted for about 4 days and then resolved itself. Same reaction just 4 days later after second dose with pain more severe and longer lasting. Currently on day 7 after second shot and pain still not resolved.
60 2021-03-28 nausea Fatigued, Nausea, Headache, Slight Fever, Occasional Irony taste in throat
60 2021-03-29 diarrhea, vomiting, abdominal pain upper I felt fine going in to get the vaccine, that evening my stomach hurt a little. And I do recall afte... Read more
Close
I felt fine going in to get the vaccine, that evening my stomach hurt a little. And I do recall after the first dose I received back on 03-01-21 I had a little stomach issue but it was gone the next day. That evening I went to bed and I began to get the worst stomach cramps I will call them and sick to my stomach feeling I had ever experienced. I did not ever get a fever. I went to the ER the next morning and had my gallbladder and Pancreas as well as the liver scanned and checked. I was told that my blood work was good only a small elevation in a part of the liver test. but it was nothing to worry about. I came hone where I laid vomiting, very lose stools, and unable to keep anything in for almost 6 days. I followed up with my regular dr and will follow up again at the end of this week. I was literally down for 6 days. My blood sugars were over the chart because I was unable to eat or drink. The cramping or pains were awful. I am still sore in my stomach but now beginning to eat and feel better.
60 2021-03-29 diarrhea Diarrhea - 3-4 times per day for 5 days
60 2021-03-29 nausea Started being cold around 11:00 on 3/29 - less energy throughout day - goose bumps from being cold a... Read more
Close

severe muscle pain in back and legs; Chills; Fatigue; Headache; severe pains in abdomen; This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable consumer, the patient. A 60-year-old male patient received BNT162b2 (COMARNITY; Lot/batch no: UNKNOWN) via an unspecified route of administration on 12Mar2021 at 09:00 AM (at 60-years-old) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient's medical history included many food and environmental allergies. Prior to the vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient was not tested for COVID-19. Concomitant medications included fluticasone propionate (FLONASE) and essential amino supplements (MANUFACTURER UNKNOWN), for unknown indications from unknown dates and unknown if ongoing. The patient received these medications within 2 weeks of vaccination. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within four weeks prior to the vaccination. On 12Mar2021 at 09:00 PM, twelve hours after the injection, the patient had severe pains in abdomen with severe muscle pain in back and legs. The patient experienced some chills, headache and fatigue which were mostly over in 24 hours. The patient did not receive any treatment for these adverse events. At the time of this report, the patient was recovering from the events abdominal pain, muscle pain, chills, headache and fatigue. No follow-up attempts are possible; information about lot number cannot be obtained.

60 2021-05-25 difficulty swallowing Per triage notes on 4/21/21: Pt had his 2nd COVID vaccine today at 0800. At 0900 developed lip swell... Read more
Close
Per triage notes on 4/21/21: Pt had his 2nd COVID vaccine today at 0800. At 0900 developed lip swelling. Took two doses of Benadryl and has now developed chest tightness and throat swelling. Per doctor's notes: Patient is a very pleasant 60-year-old gentleman who comes in for evaluation after a possible allergic reaction today, possibly related to a second dose of Pfizer Covid vaccine that he got at 8 AM this morning. About an hour later he started to feel flushed. He felt like his face was warm and his ears were warm. He started to feel like the inside of his mouth had filled with a rubber ball. His tongue felt full and he started noticed progressively that he felt like he was having difficulty swallowing. States that he never actually had any lip swelling, contrary to the triage note, just felt funny in the interior of his mouth. Did feel like his tongue was slightly swollen, both based on the fact that it felt "thick" when he was talking, and on direct inspection, as well. Took 50 mg of Benadryl around the time that his symptoms started, and lay down to nap for a little while. When he woke up he was still feeling like he was having more difficulty swallowing. He also felt like his face was a little bit puffy, prickly under each eye. He also felt like he had a blotchy rash on his chest and upper back, which his wife corroborates. He felt like his chest was a little bit tight and that something was heavy on his chest, though he was not wheezing or acutely short of breath, per se. Took another 50 mg of Benadryl at about 2:15 PM, and presented to the emergency department for further evaluation. Currently still has a little bit of chest tightness and throat tightness. He feels flushed. Symptoms have not worsened, but they have not completely resolved, either. He has had anaphylaxis in the past and has had to be admitted to the hospital. And this was in relation to taking doxycycline, it sounds like. Patient presented again to the ED on 4/22/21 with the same symptoms. He was admitted with anaphylaxis. Per ED notes, also diagnosed with Angioedema, improved. Likely related to second covid vaccine. Cant rule out secondary to Lisinopril.
60 2021-05-27 difficulty swallowing Post vaccination at approximately 10:30 am client reported feeling numbness and tingling in hands, d... Read more
Close
Post vaccination at approximately 10:30 am client reported feeling numbness and tingling in hands, developing a cough and a subsequently developing a felling of throat "closure" or tightness. Client was evaluated by Emergency response team and relocated to the Emergency response tents. At 10:45 am client was noted to become hoarse and requiring neck extension to swallow water. Client at this point was reported to be unable to speak in full sentences. Epinephrine was administered by Emergency Response physician at 10:50 AM. EMS was on site, oxygen was administered and transport to a nearby hospital emergency room was initiated and completed. Note: In retrospect client stated that he had similar symptoms after his first intramuscular vaccine dose (Pfizer, three weeks prior) for three days and had self medicated with Benadryl but had subsequently felt better.

Close
Chest pain in heart region at night progressing to pain radiating down left arm and up left side of neck and slight nausea. Symptoms similar to beginning of heart attack, so went to emergency room for observation. No signs of heart attack were detected and emergency room doctor suggested follow up with heart specialist. Follow up also showed no heart attack occurred. Pericarditis not detected with stethoscope but was suspected. Pain in heart region was not severe, ~level 2, but was persistent. Heart doctor said that was not consistent with heart attack which tends to be severe but episodic. Slight pain noticeable in heart region for weeks afterward and still evident but now very slight. Not acute, but joint pain seems slightly increased after the vaccine.
60 2021-06-17 vomiting, nausea Talking caused SOB & nauseous/vomiting; Talking caused SOB & nauseous/vomiting; Fatigue after vaccin... Read more
Close
Talking caused SOB & nauseous/vomiting; Talking caused SOB & nauseous/vomiting; Fatigue after vaccination; fatigue increases.; Passed out at end of trip (confirmed ventricular tachycardia); Passed out at end of trip (confirmed ventricular tachycardia); Unable to walk > 10 ft/During trip, difficultly walking uphill; By midMay tolerates walking but gets SOB on staris/talking caused SOB & nauseous/vomiting/By midMay tolerates walking but gets SOB on stairs; Admitted to hospital (6/4) in 100% A fib & significant ventricular arrhythmias.; Admitted to hospital (6/4) in 100% A fib & significant ventricular arrhythmias; Continued to worsen; Right ventricle pumping inadequately; Cardiogenic shock; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer. A 60-year-old male patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE, Formulation: solution for injection, Lot number: Unknown) via an unspecified route of administration, on 23May2021 (at the age of 60-years-old), as unknown dose, single dose for COVID-19 immunization and varicella zoster vaccine RGE (CHO) (SHINGRIX) on 27May2021 for immunization. Medical history was not reported. Concomitant medications included Furosemide (LASIX). Prior to vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, it was unknown if the patient had been tested for COVID-19. It was unknown if the patient received any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. On 04Jun2021 after vaccination, the patient experienced fatigue and it was increased. By mid of the May the patient tolerates walking but got shortness of breath (SOB) on stairs. On 20May2021, the physician doubled Furosemide (LASIX) dose for unspecified trip. During the trip, the patient had difficulty walking uphill. It was reported that patient passed out at end of trip, it was confirmed with ventricular tachycardia. On an unknown date, the patient underwent echocardiogram, and the ejection fraction was 25%. On 04Jun2021, the patient admitted to hospital in 100% atrial fibrillation & significant ventricular arrhythmias. The patient was treated with Intravenous heparin and he was kept for 2 nights in the hospital. It continued to worsen. On 08Jun21, the patient was unable to walk more than 10 feet, while talking caused shortness of breath and nauseous/vomiting. The patient was admitted to another hospital. On an unknown date, in hospital the patient had an esophageal echo to rule out (R/o) any clots in heart or lungs. On 09Jun2021, a cardioversion and on 10Jun2021, an angiogram was performed, it did not show any blockage or valve problems but showed the right ventricle pumping inadequately. The patient was advised new medications which included amiodorone. The patient was currently diagnosed with cardiogenic shock and expected to remain in CCU (cardiac care unit) until end of week. It was also reported the patient was hospitalized for Life threatening illness (immediate risk of death from the event). Seriousness criteria was reported as life threatening and prolonged hospitalization. The outcome of all the events was unknown. Information on Lot/Batch number has been requested.

Close
High fever; Vomiting; Severe fatigue; Weakness; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable physician (patient himself). This 61-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Lot number EL1442), via intramuscular, on 05Jan2021 at single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Age at vaccination was 61-year-old. Vaccine location was deltoid left. The subject did not have a relevant medical history and concomitant medications. On 06Jan2021, the patient developed high fever, vomiting, severe fatigue and weakness. He did not experience anaphylaxis. The events were considered serious as medically significant. The patient stated that side effects mentioned lasted 3 hours and he felt much better now. However, the final clinical outcome was unknown. The patient is not sure if he should get the shot again in 3 weeks since he was really sick. The reporting physician considered the events 'high fever', 'vomiting', 'severe fatigue' and 'weakness' related to BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE).; Sender's Comments: Based on temporal association, the causal relationship between BNT162B2 and the events pyrexia, vomiting, fatigue and asthenia cannot be excluded. The information available in this report is limited and does not allow a medically meaningful assessment. This case will be reassessed once additional information becomes available. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.

He wanted to know if others had reported this same palpitation. The reporter further reported that he has a little bit of concern. He felt fine, had sore arm and fatigue that has gone away. Close
anxious, restless, weak, dizzy, felt "horrible". Continued to C/O symptoms,. At 01:15, patient lost consciousness , then stopped breathing and lost pulse. Narrative: Patient was first vaccinated for COVID 19 on 1/8/21. On 1/24/21: 61 year old presents to E.R. with CC of chest pain/sob, with multiple medical conditions including hypertension, atrial fibrillation on apixaban, cardiomyopathy with poor EF, dyslipidemia, COPD, CVA, lung CA s/p radiotherapy, PTSD, depression, Churg Strauss Syndrome, Sjogren's syndrome presented with chief complaint of chest pain or shortness of breath. He has been having worsening shortness of breath the past few days, also complains of cough productive of yellowish sputum, no hemoptysis. He complains of left upper chest pain with no radiation. There is no diaphoresis, palpitations or lightheadedness. He denies fever or chills. He complains of having fallen a few times recently, thus he passed out. Could not say if there were seizures activity. Admitted to 3D Tele. On 1/27, Pt advises he had episode of substernal CP this am. RN advises pt was in afib w/ RVR at a rate >140 at time of CP. Pt CP improved w/ prn NTG. Pt HR improved after daily medications. Pt sts his CP has resolved. Pt admits to continued dyspnea. Increased trop, transferred. 1/28, struggling with orthopnea and cough. He has no peripheral edema. He does have intermittent chest pain. Patient having periods of A-Fib RVR with non-sustained rates of 140's-150's 1/29 more chest pain at 04:00, relieved with NTG. HR = AF, with RVR 145. At about 08:00, Cardiology sees patient and signs off, "shortness of breath and cough not due to heart failure as evidenced by orthostatic hypotension and no improvement in symptoms with diuresis. Consider underlying lung disease vs acute pulmonary disease." No pulmonary consult noted. 1/29 Patient received 2nd dose COVID19 vaccine at about 3:30-4p. No notes from staff on this event. No notes from MD that this was discussed and still part of the plan. 1/29 nurse's note: At around 2240 Pt was able to rest briefly but is now restless and anxious again. Tachypneic, stating he feels so weak and dizzy and overall just feel horrible. Continuing to get up frequently to have small soft bowel movements with assistance. Pt also stated ever since he got "that shot" he hasn't felt well. When asked what shot pt replied "COVID shot." Pt did receive 2nd dose of COVID vaccine 1/29 at 1530. Around 2250 Spoke w MOD to relay above information and overall concern for pt, asked for MOD to come to bedside to evaluate pt. MOD states he's handing off to oncoming MOD and they will come to bedside to see pt. Around 2300 oncoming MOD called and all above and previous information discussed Around 2310 MOD came to bedside to see pt. Will continue to monitor closely. 01/30/2021 ADDENDUM Around 0115 pt called for help to use bedside commode to urinate and have BM. Assisted x2 to BSC. While sitting on BSC pt's eyes rolled back and pt made postures consistent with a seizure, body became very rigid. Pt was unresponsive still with pulse. Lifted patient back to bed with 3 staff assist. Pt stopped breathing and lost pulse. Chest compressions started immediately and Code Blue called at 0120. 1/30 Hospitalist note: Called for CODE BLUE AGAIN AT 4:53. While on Vent after s/p Code blue for reasons not clear patient went into Asystole and code called second time. Patient had a prolonged CPR and was actually called off at 5:17 but he started having pulse and agonal resp. he was placed on Levophed and D5NS. He got a total of 9 amps of epi, 3 amps od Bicarb and 1amp of D50. Trope bumped from 0.12 to 0.43 prior to this he already was on ASA, Apixiban for afib. Cards are on board for his CHF for his pulmonary edema Lasix ordered. Hid lactic acid is elevated. Blood cultures pending. Started Zosyn and is on Levophed. Continue to monitor. Updated patients Mom and she requested to do everything at this point. Coded again at 5:40, survived, but AOD writes a death note(?) Coded for the 4th time at 08:18. Family at beside, Mother asks for code to be stopped.

Upon receipt of follow-up information on 27Jan2021, this case now contains all required information to be considered valid. This is a spontaneous report from a contactable physician. Concomitant medication included acetylsalicylic acid (ASPIRIN), clopidogrel bisulfate (PLAVIX). It was reported that the patient had swelling and severe tenderness left his arm. He couldn't sleep last night because he had throbbing headache and back pain on 18Dec2020. Initially, he had nausea. Patient stated further stated that Headache and swelling and extreme tenderness of the site of injection, that is the swelling, no redness but the swelling and tender and painful. Initially, he had till now the mild back pain. He patient said she took Tylenol. She also mentioned that initially she had like metallic taste and then disappear. The patient also had dizziness a little bit. The outcome of the event vaccination site swelling, dysgeusia and tenderness was recovered on unspecified dates, headache and back pain was not recovered, recovering for nausea while unknown for the remaining events.

significant swelling and redness at the injection site with minimal pain; significant swelling and redness at the injection site with minimal pain; significant swelling and redness at the injection site with minimal pain; weakness; Nausea; mild myalgia; general muscle pain and aches; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable physician (patient). A 61-year-old male patient received the second dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Solution for injection, lot number: EK9231, expiry date: not reported), via an unspecified route of administration, on 28Jan2021 09:00 AM at a single dose on the left arm for COVID-19 immunization. The vaccine was administered at a hospital. It was not administered at a military facility. He did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to receiving bnt162b2. The patient had no relevant medical history and concomitant medications to report.The patient previously received the first dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: EK9231, expiry date: not reported, NDC number: 59267-1000-1), on 09Jan2021 09:30 AM on the left arm for COVID-19 immunization, at the age of 61-year-old. He experienced myalgia at the injection site/pain at inject site after the first dose on 09Jan2021 and resolved on 12Jan2021. The first and second doses of bnt162b2 had the same lot number. On 28Jan2021, the patient received the second dose of bnt162b2. 24 hours later, on 29Jan2021, he experienced mild aches/pain, nausea/malaise. Three days (42-72hours) after 2nd dose, on 31Jan2021, he experienced "significant redness" and swelling at injection site with minimal pain. He described it as "Out of proportion to what should be expected". The redness and swelling were improving at the time of the report (01Feb2021). He asked if this should be of concern. He also asked if it was possible that the vaccine was given subcutaneously instead of intramuscularly. He developed a good amount of swelling and redness at the injection site. It seemed fine the first day. It took two or more days to develop the swelling. He added that he only had mild myalgia, weakness, and nausea initially on 29Jan2021 after the second dose of the vaccine. Then 48 hours later, he got the large amount of swelling and redness at the injection site. He later clarified he received the first dose of the Pfizer COVID 19 vaccine on 9Jan2021 at 09:30 AM in the left arm. He had some myalgia at the injection site on 09Jan2021 that went away on 12Jan2021. Then he received the second dose of the Pfizer COVID 19 vaccine on 28Jan2021 at 09:00 AM in the left arm. Initially he had no pain. 24 hours later, on 29Jan2021, he had myalgia referring to general muscle pain and aches and nausea that only lasted about two hours. He is mostly concerned now about the significant swelling and redness at the injection site with minimal pain which he noticed 48 to 72 hours after the second dose of the vaccine. He took some Aleve which gave some relief (for significant swelling and redness at the injection site with minimal pain). He asked if this is an expected side effect as it seem out of proportion to him. Outcome of events general muscle pain and aches and weakness was recovered on 30Jan2021. Outcome of event nausea was recovered on 29Jan2021. Outcome of events significant swelling and redness at the injection site with minimal pain was recovering. The reporting physician (patient) assessed the causality between the suspect vaccine and all events as related. He assessed the events "swelling and redness at the injection site with minimal pain" as medically significant (serious), while he assessed the other events as non-serious.; Sender's Comments: Based on temporal association and known product safety profile of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Solution for injection, lot number: EK9231, expiry date: not reported), the contributory role of the product cannot be totally excluded. The events are known adverse event of the product. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators, as appropriate.

61 2021-04-14 nausea This patient came in to the community center to receive his 2nd dose of his Pfizer vaccine at approx... Read more
Close
This patient came in to the community center to receive his 2nd dose of his Pfizer vaccine at approx 10:06am. At approx 10 minutes after sitting in the observation area, the patient started to fee hot, dizzy, some tunneled vision and nausea. This attendee did not have any sort of reaction to his first dose. This was brought to the attention of one of the observing staff members. This nurse, was called over to the patient. The attendee was asked to lay down on the cot provided and we elevated his legs. RN, measured his vital signs: bp 110/70, HR: 60, Resp 16, O2 97%. This patient denied any shortness of breath. Lung sounds were clear, and no wheezing or rhonchi were observed. This patient stated he has a history of Asthma and took his asthma medications this morning as normally directed. This patient was directed to lay down for approx 10 minutes, then stated he felt much better and wanted to sit up and take a sip of water. The attendee tolerated the water well. This nurse, advised for this attendee to stay for another 10 minutes until he had no symptoms present. The patient quickly felt better and stated that his wife was out in the car and would be driving him home. This nurse advised for him to go to the Emergency Room if he felt any of these symptoms again.

61 2021-04-21 difficulty swallowing, nausea Tongue swelling; could not process his breath; Could not swallow his saliva; headache; Nausea; This ... Read more
Close
Tongue swelling; could not process his breath; Could not swallow his saliva; headache; Nausea; This is a solicited report from a non-Pfizer sponsored program (marketing program name not available) from a contactable consumer, based on information received by Pfizer(manufacturer control number: US-AMGEN-USASL2021053617), license party for etanercept (ENBREL). This non-serious solicited report (USASL2021053617) was reported on 07/APR/2021 by a consumer from a commercial program (PSP00046b) and involves a 61 year old male patient who had headache [PT: headache], nausea [PT: nausea], tongue swelling [PT: swollen tongue], could not process his breath [PT: dyspnoea] and could not swallow his saliva [PT: dysphagia] while receiving Enbrel with Single Dose Prefilled Autoinjector. No historical medical condition was reported. The patient's current medical condition included psoriatic arthritis. The patient's concomitant medications included methotrexate. The patient's co-suspect medication included covid-19 vaccine. The patient began Enbrel with Single Dose Prefilled Autoinjector on an unknown date. It was reported that the patient was using Enbrel for about five to six years. On an unknown date in MAR/2021, the patient received a recent injection of Enbrel. On 27/MAR/2021 at 10:00 AM, the patient received covid-19 vaccine. On the same day, the patient had nausea and headache but then it went away. On the same day at 05:30 PM, the patient had tongue swelling. The patient could not swallow his saliva and could not process his breath. Subsequently, the patient went to ER (Emergency room) and was started on Benadryl (diphenhydramine hydrochloride), prednisone and ranitidine. The patient was instructed by the physician not to receive a second dose of covid vaccine. The outcome of the events headache and nausea was reported as recovered/resolved. The outcome of the events swollen tongue, dyspnoea and dysphagia was reported as unknown. The events headache, nausea were resolved on 27/MAR/2021. Action taken with Enbrel with Single Dose Prefilled Autoinjector was reported as unknown for the events headache, nausea, swollen tongue, dyspnoea and dysphagia. The causal relationship between the events headache, nausea, swollen tongue, dyspnoea, dysphagia and Enbrel with Single Dose Prefilled Autoinjector was not provided by the consumer. Follow up has been requested for lot number. Causality Assessment: Events Swallowing difficult, Breathing difficult, Swelling of tongue and Nausea were assessed to be not related to etanercept.; Sender's Comments: Based on a temporal association and the known safety profile, the reported events are considered possibly related to BNT162B2. The events were unrelated to etanercept. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators, as appropriate.
61 2021-04-22 abdominal pain Starting 3-4 days after injection, began to have increasing pain in buttocks. Pain became more seve... Read more
Close
Starting 3-4 days after injection, began to have increasing pain in buttocks. Pain became more severe, spread to hips, then to knees/quadriceps over next 3 days - during this time, pain was relieved with Tylenol for 2-3 hours, then the pain would "break through" the Tylenol. Three days after onset pain was unbearable and consistent for 2-3 days. The pain slowly subsided over next 3 days without intervention. Morphine and Valium was required to manage pain in ER.

Close
Severe Headache; Muscle ache; Abdominal pain; lost his appetite; had a horrible feeling in his stomach, almost like the stomach flu; cold and had trouble maintaining his body heat; significant weight loss, he went from 218 lbs. to 210 lbs. so he lost 8 lbs. over a week; nausea in his stomach to the point where he couldn't eat and every time he did try to eat, it made him really sick; Sore Arm; Runny Nose with Mucous; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 61-year-old male patient received the second dose of BNT162B2, via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Left on 31Mar2021 (Batch/Lot Number: EN6206) (at age of 61-year-old) as single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included Slightly Diabetic from 2009 to an unknown date. The patient stated he doesn't smoke or do drugs, or drink and he tried to eat good healthy food. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. The patient previously took the first dose of BNT162B2 on 10Mar2021 (at age of 61-year-old) (Lot number: EN6200) and experienced sore arm and runny nose with mucous. The patient experienced sore arm on 01Apr2021, runny nose with mucous on 01Apr2021, nausea in his stomach to the point where he couldn't eat and every time he did try to eat, it made him really sick on 02Apr2021 , severe headache on 07Apr2021, muscle ache on 05Apr2021, abdominal pain on 02Apr2021, lost his appetite on 02Apr2021, had a horrible feeling in his stomach, almost like the stomach flu on 02Apr2021, cold and had trouble maintaining his body heat on 02Apr2021, significant weight loss, he went from 218 lbs. to 210 lbs. so he lost 8 lbs. over a week on 02Apr2021.Clinical course: The patient had his second shot last Wednesday, 31MAR2021, and he was calling to report his adverse side effects. The patient stated he had a sore arm which was okay and runny nose with mucous, which was similar to his experience with his first shot, but then things went downhill. The patient stated with the first vaccine, he had arm pain that evening and it really wasn't bad. Stated there was an hour where it was really intense like he got shot up with something pretty powerful, he had a yucky feeling like when you catch the flu and get the first kick and then it went away. Stated he had a runny nose that first came on and lasted pretty much until he got the second vaccine, stated it got not so severe and heavy and decreased until the second shot and then went up again. Stated with the second vaccine he lost his appetite and he developed nausea in his stomach to the point where he couldn't eat and every time he did try to eat, it made him really sick. Clarified he did not have vomiting or diarrhea. Stated he just had a horrible feeling in his stomach, almost like the stomach flu. The patient stated yesterday (07Apr2021) was bad and he spent the last 2 days in bed. Stated while he was sick, her ate half a sandwich, that was all he could stomach and could eat. Stated he had significant weight loss, he went from 218 lbs. to 210 lbs. so he lost 8 lbs. over a week. Stated looking at his waist line he can tell he has lost weight. Clarified most of the pain was in his lower abdominal pelvis region, large intestine area. Stated he had a severe headache yesterday (07Apr2021). Clarified that it has significantly improved. Stated he still felt tension in his head but nothing compared to yesterday (07Apr2021) with the pounding migraine type of headache. Stated he was cold and had trouble maintaining his body heat. The patient clarified the phases of his events mimic the flu but unlike the flu, he wasn't coughing, but he was having the physical pain of the flu but not the normal symptoms you would expect like heavy mucous, coughing, sneezing, like if he had the flu or a cold, but he felt like he was going through the flu. Stated he had muscle aches. States his back is normally okay but he injured it in the past and it started to hurt especially at the points that were injured. The patient stated just before he called, his husband brought him some soup and he just finished that and he didn't feel immediately sick after eating something so it seems to have significantly improved. Caller states yesterday (07Apr2021) was the worst. Stated he has isolated, he didn't have to go out and lives in the mountains, he only goes out for groceries and they bring it out to him. Stated he did go to the hospital where he received the vaccine, he could have picked up something at the hospital. Stated he hasn't exposed himself to anything, no bars, gym, church, he is not hanging out with anyone, he maintained as restrictive environment as one could have and he wears a mask when they are putting the groceries in his vehicle. Restated that yesterday (07Apr2021) and last night were the worst and everything has significantly improved. Treatment: Been in bed for the last 36 hours, today (08Apr2021) he is actually up enjoying a beautiful day. The events did not result in emergency room visit or physician office visit. AE(s) following prior vaccinations: Every time got flu shot, and he didn't get them anymore, he got sick as a dog for a couple of weeks, with yellow phlegm. Stated he thought it was supposed to protect him, why is he so sick and hacking up phlegm? Stated maybe he is one of those people that doesn't do well with vaccines. Stated this is a new type of vaccine MRNA and it could just be him. Stated not all vaccines, it seems like flu vaccine kicks him in the keister but has had other vaccines like the MMR and no issues with that, no pain no nothing. The outcome of events Sore Arm was resolved on 03Apr2021 and Runny Nose with Mucous was resolved on 06Apr2021 and of the rest of events was Resolving. No follow-up attempts are possible; No further information is expected.

On Friday, April 23/ 2021 @4PM I began to feel pressure built up on my chest. @ 4:15 the pressure also built up on my neck. I was short of breath and I can feel the heartbeat way too high. I laid down on the sofa and must have passed out. 20 minutes later I began to come around but I was way weak and the heart beat was beginning to relax. Close
Nausea started a few days after my second dose. I contacted my PCP . He recommended doing COVID test, which I did at the Hospital - results were negative. I have ruled out diet as a source of nausea by fasting (significantly lower food intake than usual). Stopped drinking tea, which aggravated nausea symptoms. The symptoms persist after 3 weeks! Nausea is strong in the morning, and little better as day goes buy. I never had this problem in past decade or so, therefore I believe its the vaccine that's doing this.

The second dose of the vaccine triggered a moderately severe RA flare lasting from 28 April to 29 April. Significant flu-like full-body joint pain, moderate fever (100.5 F against a normal base of 97.3), and light nausea. Joint pain continues as is usual for such flares, since some light damage likely occurred in my joints. I was unable to take NSAID or Prednisone (as I normally would for a flare) due to the vaccine. Acetaminophen taken but ineffective. NOTE: My RA is being treated with Rituximab, two doses every 4 months. Next dose scheduled 11 May 2021. Prior dose completed 12 January 2021.

The patient's medical history includes ongoing nausea and Not able to eat/ he can't drink or eat. Just thinking about eating makes him nauseated and threw up. Concomitant medications were not reported. The patient experienced whole body aches, he can't sleep and feels like crap on 31Jan2021. The patient also experienced diarrhea on 02Feb2021. The patient mentioned that on the morning of the vaccine, Sunday, he woke up, and tried to drink coffee and threw up. The Sunday morning he was nauseous before the shot. When he drank his coffee that morning. In the mornings, he can't drink or eat. Just thinking about eating makes him nauseated. His body aches started a little while after the shot. It was still Sunday when they started though. He can't sleep the body aches are so bad. Sunday evening is when he started to feel like crap. He has also had diarrhea. fever at 100.4; Headache; Nausea; Sniffles; Chills; he was beated down with sweat; body aches; does not have an appetite; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 62-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), lot number: EH9899, intramuscular in the left arm, on 08Jan2021 16:30 at 0.3 mL, single for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included ongoing high blood pressure and spinal surgery in Jan2019. Patient's eyesight was not the greatest. Patient previously received flu vaccine on an unspecified date (the last couple of years). Concomitant medication included amlodipine besilate for blood pressure. He was scheduled to get second dose on 29Jan2021. The Saturday before he was scheduled to get the second dose (23Jan2021), he started feeling sniffles and stuff. He went to urgent care and he was tested for covid and the test came back negative. He then kept feeling bad. He clarified that on 24Jan2021, he had headache and nausea. He had chills and he was beated down with sweat; body aches which are constant and he would try to blame it on the position he was laying in while on the couch and it was not that; and does not have an appetite on an unspecified day in Jan2021. He has been in really bad shape for the last 9 or 10 days. When he went to go get his second shot, they would not give it to him due to his symptoms that he was experiencing since she had a fever at 100.4 the night before (28Jan2021). They scheduled him to get his second dose the following which was this Friday. He was asking if his side effects are totally normal. He cannot even sleep, reported that he will sleep an hour and then up for two or three hours. It really has him, and he feels miserable. The outcome of events Chills, nausea and fever at 100.4 was not recovered. Outcome of sniffles was recovered in Jan 2021 while the outcome of the remaining events was unknown. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of sniffles; he went to urgent care and they gave him something like zyrtec, states it was an allergy medication and it wiped out the sniffles for fever, he will take Tylenol and it will break the fever for a few hours and then his fever comes right back. Follow-up attempts are completed. The information on the batch/lot number has been obtained.

62 2021-03-11 vomiting 62 yo M with no known medical history awoke 12:15 am on 3/11/2021 and told his wife he had "pain all... Read more
Close
62 yo M with no known medical history awoke 12:15 am on 3/11/2021 and told his wife he had "pain all over". When she asked if it was chest pain, he said he didn't know. He went downstairs, vomited, slumped over against the wall behind the couch, and became unresponsive. Wife called 911 and was instructed to begin CPR. EMS crew arrived shortly after that and performed prolonged resuscitation efforts as per ACLS protocol. Pt pronounced at 3:15 am. Patient had not seen a physician in many years, had not had any vaccines in over 20 years, took no medications, and had no known medical history. He did have a strong family history of heart disease and had told his wife the week prior to his death that he had suffered a several-hour bout of chest pain that resolved spontaneously 2-3 days prior to his telling her about it. He refused to seek medical evaluation despite her urging.

The patient can't hear nothing out of it, it's just ringing. The ringing didn't start until last night when he was sleeping. Stated he woke up and his ear was ringing. UA on 4/13 consistent with a UTI and started on Bactrim. On 4/14 he started having chills and weakness with kidney pain on the left side. CT abdomen and pelvis on 4/14 showed a left kidney calyceal diverticula with calcification in the superior pole that could have been a nidus for infection with symptoms showing 5 days after COVID vaccine. Increased suspicion for pyelonephritis and antibiotic changed to Macrobid. After a few days of increased hydration and antibiotics, urinary symptoms improved. Will continue monitoring kidney infection. Still had flu-like symptoms as of 4/15. Heart rate was first recorded on 4/13 at 113 and again on 4/16 at 111. Patient stated it had been elevated all week. Approximately, 1 minute after receiving his first dose of the Pfizer Vaccine the patient was noted to be slipping out of his chair. One of the staff members tried to help the patient to the floor but did not make in enough time to break the fall. The patient lost all consciousness and hit the back of his head on the floor. He awoke after about 5-10 seconds and was A&O x 4. EMS arrived at about that time. The patient continued to c/o dizziness and was notably pale. After a few minutes he was able to sit up. But then began to feel like he would pass out again. Patient was laid back and feet propped up on floor and then placed on heart monitor. VS were WNL. Rate and rhythm were also WNL. Soreness on the around the shot site; Severe arm pain up where the rotator cuff is; Severe arm pain up where the rotator cuff is; Has not slept due to pain; cannot sleep, the pain wakes him up; Could not use his arm; 50% deficit with the use of his left arm; After the vaccine, he could not lift his arm above his mid face level; Burning and tingling down the left arm; went to his hand and fingertips and progressed to the whole left side of his body including his rib line, hip, leg, and foot; Burning and tingling down the left arm; went to his hand and fingertips and progressed to the whole left side of his body including his rib line, hip, leg, and foot; Nauseous; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient who is a retired paramedic). A 62-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE; Lot Number: ER8732), via an unspecified route of administration in left arm, on 30Mar2021 at 01:00 PM (13:00), as first dose, single, for COVID-19 immunization. The patient's medical history included bipolar depression from probably 10 years ago (2011) and ongoing, torn rotator cuff (15 to 20 years ago), and food poisoning in mid-Aug2020 (maybe it was more than that; may get tested to see if he ever had COVID-19). The patient's concomitant medication included vilazodone hydrochloride (VIIBRYD) from 2017 and ongoing (for at least four years) for bipolar depression. The patient has no known allergies. The patient was one of those people who doesn't get sick and he doesn't normally get the flu shot and everyone told him to get this Pfizer vaccine. The patient was not panicking but got the first dose of the Pfizer Vaccine on Tuesday (30Mar2021) around 01:00 PM and saw some things about having soreness on the around the shot site and all of that from that night (30Mar2021). This is going on for three days (from 30Mar2021) with severe arm pain up where the rotator cuff is; if you ever have pulled a rotator cuff it feels like that and he has not slept in almost 3 days due to pain from 30Mar2021. The pain is severe at times that it makes him nauseous (Mar2021). He figured the soreness was normal and later in the evening on 30Mar2021, the pain became an issue when he tried to go to bed that evening. Since the first two nights compared to last night, the soreness is actually improved; every time he tries to sleep with pain as a factor it is not easy. The patient can feel throbbing with his heartbeat and with the circulation there is throbbing pain. The pain was terrible and was throbbing like his heartbeat and similar to like a shoulder rotator cuff injury. For the first two days, on Tuesday (30Mar2021) and Wednesday (31Mar2021) after the vaccine, he could not use his arm or lift his arm above his mid face level. According to the patient, it was like a rotator cuff and he had a torn rotator cuff 15 to 20 years ago and this is the same arm that his torn rotator cuff occurred in; this is very painful and he is comparing it to the torn rotator cuff. In Mar2021, the patient had burning and tingling down the left arm and 3 days no sleep because the pain is worse at night. During the last week (Mar2021), his left leg down to his foot is also tingling and burning. The patient's primary care physician just retired, and he is in the process of finding a new one. The patient had no treatment or physician or emergency room (ER) visit for the reported events because being in the ER field, he can tell right now that it would be a waste of time of the effort to go into the ER as they would do nothing but tell him to take paracetamol (TYLENOL) and that is it. The patient did not like to take paracetamol and hates taking paracetamol. The patient clarified it is generic acetaminophen extra strength (Strength: 500 mg; Lot Number: P119682, Expiration Date: Mar2022, UPC Number: 5084417594) that he has taken (maybe every 6 hours oral) and it does relieve the pain so that is only so good. He does not know if in motion of the course of the day, something happened because at night laying still in bed is when he has pain. The patient did a lot of research before he made this call and the severity of the pain is enough to actually keep him awake for three days. He thought it was severe pain; maybe he should have told them to administer the vaccine in his right arm, but it was administered into his left arm. The only reason he made this call was because he wanted someone to know what he was having which could be just completely normal and he is sure every reaction is different and he expected the soreness because he remembers as a kid having shots. Also, this level of pain he is experiencing is what he wanted to report; imagine having himself going three days without a full night of sleep and he wanted to report this to make sure Pfizer knew this if they were keeping track of numbers of how many people have a similar pain level. The patient also asked if there were other people who called and reported these symptoms and if there is any information or treatment recommendations. As of 08Apr2021, even up to five days after getting the shot, now going on seven days that he has had some pretty severe reactions. The patient called in after 3 nights of getting no sleep. The patient was calling today to see if someone was ever going to call him back and asking will there be a follow up call from someone to see if he's still alive. The patient had some pretty severe reactions and they have actually gotten worse. There also have been new developments. The patient had pain in his arm that pulses along with his heart rate. It is so bad that it kept him up for 3 nights and still wakes him up at night. The pulsing pain in his arm started on the first night and has gradually gotten worse. The pain in the arm that is enough that it keeps him awake at night only starts getting severe when he goes to bed. He has tried sleeping in an upright position and he has tried everything, and nothing seems to alleviate it. The patient took generic acetaminophen which did not work during his last phone call. The patient also tried naproxen sodium (ALEVE) and that doesn't work wither. It was absolutely debilitating at times to where he has a 50% deficit with the use of his left arm (Mar2021). The patient initially reported burning and tingling sensation that was on his left arm and went to his hand and fingertips but now it has progressed to the whole left side of his body including his rib line, hip, leg, and foot. He is a retired paramedic and is pretty sure he is not having a long stroke. The patient feels it is too long to have symptoms from a shot he got. The patient has a lot of friends in the medical field and he's been told even going to a primary care physician, it is kind of gray area when it comes to dealing with COVID-19 vaccines. The patient was having second thoughts about getting the second shot. He had been told he can take NSAIDS over the counter for pain which has not helped him; there is no protocol for diagnosing or treating anything that happens from the shot. People in the medical field have told him there is thin line now to treat side effects because of liability; some doctors won't even get into it, just refer to Pfizer because medical insurance will not cover any services related to COVID-19 vaccine reactions. The patient continues to explain that is why the federal government is the only one that owns the shot due to liability. The patient's main concern is calling and reporting and maybe getting some help in deciding whether or not to get the second dose of the Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine. In his opinion, that is too long to have pain that he cannot sleep, the pain wakes him up. This all happened along with the shot, the same night and there are times where he can't work due to it. The patient asks if anyone is concerned with it and will someone feel bad because he doesn't get the second shot. His main concern is that people are underscoring or even lying about side effects, stating he can't believe he is an isolated case. The patient continued to ask if this is something he's stuck with, or if it is something he would have to deal with from now on from getting this shot. The patient regrets getting the first shot and stated that if he knew then what he would be going through now, he wouldn't have got it. The patient has no sort of history of being a hypochondriac and the feelings he is going through right now are sensations that he has never felt in his life. The patient continues to explain he doesn't even know how to categorize it other than mentally relating it to the shot since it all occurred in line with Mar2021 getting the shot. The patient further commented that if he ran a call with an ambulance right now with a patient telling him what i he was telling the company, he wouldn't even know what to do with them other than getting them comfortable and to a hospital. The patient had not recovered from "Soreness on the around the shot site", "Severe arm pain up where the rotator cuff is", and " Has not slept due to pain; cannot sleep, the pain wakes him up". The outcome of the other events was unknown.

Close
7:45am April 13th, 2021 at hospital I was very excited to finally get the vaccine ...I was given the Pfizer shot in my upper left arm and felt small pain a the site of injection ...In 5 minutes I felt nauseated, very dizzy and weak to the point of falling off the chair ...they gave me two cups of orange juice and a few fig bars in the hopes that I was just having low blood sugar ...I was offered a hospital bed to lay down ...I experienced numbness in my left arm and in both hands ...also across the lower part of my face ...I was at the hospital for over an hour an was unable to return to work ... A few days later I began experiencing high pitch ringing in both ears that has gotten worse to the point of being so loud I can't hear a person talking to me on the phone ...noises around me are extremely painful to my inner ear ...this high pitch sound wont go away and keeps me up all night ...I have been to the hospital several times to see ENT doctors and I have tried many medications to help me sleep with this 24/7 tortuous ringing sound ...I can keep myself busy all day trying to ignore it yet at night it haunts me like a demon ...please contact me with any help you know of to reduce this sound in my ears ...I am extremely desperate for sleep ...
62 2021-05-14 diarrhea He has been having diarrhea for the past 2 weeks ever since he received a second Covid vaccination h... Read more
Close
He has been having diarrhea for the past 2 weeks ever since he received a second Covid vaccination he has been increasingly weak and could barely make it into the pulmonary function lab. At the pulmonary function lab, he was found to have new onset atrial fibrillation and worsening hypoxemia from baseline. Taken to ED from the lab on 5/12, found to have right middle lobe and right lower lobe consolidation and ground glass changes. Admitted. Conditioned worsened, respiratory acidosis and shock, started on biped and pressors. Taken to ICU. Found to have RV failure. Today he was intubated.

Patient alerted nurse they were not feeling well, and nurse noted patient was breathing fine. No rapid response was called, however patient was sent over to ED with wheelchair. 62 2021-05-26 nausea, vomiting The day after the second dose of the Pfizer vaccine, my father started to experience lethargy, heada... Read more
Close
The day after the second dose of the Pfizer vaccine, my father started to experience lethargy, headaches, nausea and vomiting. These are all advertised as common symptoms of the second dose so he did not seek medical treatment until 5/11/21, five days after. He went to the emergency room, his systolic blood pressure was over 200. A CT scan showed bleeding going from his basal ganglia to the right ventricle of his brain. His blood pressure had gotten so high that he had a hemorrhagic stroke. He has since been in the ICU. He had to undergo a ventriculostomy, was put onto a ventilator, and has now had a tracheostomy. He still has not regained full motor function and will have a long road to recovery after the stroke.

Communication: Caller was encouraged to reach out to her husbands healthcare provider, urgent care or emergency room for medical advice. Caller declines to provide further information and disconnects the call. No further information provided or obtained. Close
I've had Covid (01/2021) and Monoclonal Antibodies (01/2021). Was told to wait 90 days before vaccination (04/29/2021 and 05/20/2021). After Covid I began experiencing severe tiredness, headache, brain fog and muscle pain. No issues after 1st vaccination. About 10 days after 2nd vaccination, the muscle pain started becoming severe. Getting up in the morning, muscle pain in legs (mostly things) started mildly, then became so severe it was impossible to put my full weight on my legs. Am able to "walk it off" after an hour or so. NSAIDS are somewhat effective. Other symptoms include tiredness, headache, muscle pain, generally feeling unwell, joint pain, diarrhea.

Severe vomiting during overnight period into next day (approximately 12 episodes in 12 hours), severe cranial pain/headache, open sore in esophagus/lower throat that prevented eating solid foods for 10 days and liquids for at least the first week, even water. Painful area surrounding sternum (uncertain if it was from the vomiting action or possibly heart damage), which also prevented food or liquid to pass down the throat due to spasms, localized pain and possibility of inducing vomit reflex. High blood glucose (ketoacidosis). General overall weakness/lack of energy. Loss of mucous in nose, throat and stomach. Loss of saliva in mouth for first week. Insomnia. High blood pressure.
62 2021-06-11 nausea 31March2021 rec'd the 2nd Pfizer shot. Next morning 1April, multiple stripes of severe muscle pain f... Read more
Close
31March2021 rec'd the 2nd Pfizer shot. Next morning 1April, multiple stripes of severe muscle pain from both ears, extending down the rear corners of neck across top of both shoulders to the shoulder joints. The 2nd set of severe pain was thin stripes of pain on the left & right sides of the spinal column from the neck to waist. The pain strips along spine disappeared in 3 days. The neck pain has continued to this day with varying intensity, sometimes random increases in pain. 7th of April 2021: Sudden onset of Covid like symptoms: extreme fatigue, extreme nausea, wild swings in perception of body temp from freezing cold which nothing warms me, to internal heat like a very high temp but not exhibiting any outward signs of fever. Felt like internal organs were heating up and nothing else like forehead or limbs etc. The symptoms of 7April2021 kept up for at least 2 weeks. No symptoms occurred together, each symptom came for varying lengths of time before subsiding and the next symptom surfaced. Towards the end of April the intensity of the symptoms was easing and eruptions were getting fewer with more time between. By end of May only the neck pain remained. BUT.... then the other symptoms reappeared in stronger form and still ongoing.

Hemorrhagic stroke/bleeding in his brain; He was feeling nauseous and had a very bad headache; He was feeling nauseous and had a very bad headache; Vomitting; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer. A 62-year-old male patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), via an unspecified route of administration on 06May2021 (Batch/Lot Number: EW0171) as 2ND DOSE, SINGLE for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included hypertension. Concomitant medication included unspecified blood pressure medications. The patient received the first dose of PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE on 15Apr2021 (Batch/lot number: EW0161) as COVID-19 immunization. Then, the 2nd dose on 06May2021. On that same day of 06May2021, he was feeling nauseous and had a very bad headache. He brushed it off as a side effect of the vaccine because that was listed as a common side effect of the vaccine on the CDC website. So, he did not seek medical attention for 5 days. It was later reported that the he suffered a hemorrhagic stroke that day after the COVID-19 vaccine administration. The patient was in the ICU after waiting 5 days to seek medical attention because the supposed to cause headaches, nausea and vomiting. But the nausea and vomiting was from his stroke, not from the normal side effect of the vaccine. They were suspecting that the bleeding in his brain started on the 07May2021. The patient had bunch of blood work (unknown results) done since the past two weeks. Outcome of the events were unknown

It felt like his intestines were twisting in knots; diarrhea; joint pain; chills; muscle pain; tiredness/exhausted; dizziness; weakness/lost strength; Arm pain; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 62-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Lot Number: EW0179), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in left arm on 20May2021 10:00 (at 62-year-old) as 1st dose, single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included ongoing HIV positive from an unspecified date (reported as 5-6 years ago), ongoing immunocompromised due to being HIV positive. History: Patient has been taking BIKTARVY daily ever since he became HIV positive which was years ago. Concomitant medication included bictegravir sodium, emtricitabine, tenofovir alafenamide fumarate (BIKTARVY) taken for HIV positive. He did have vaccinations but he had them way longer than the 4 weeks prior to receiving his first dose of the COVID vaccine. No events following prior vaccinations. The patient stated he received his first dose of the Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine on 20May2021 and this weekend 29May2021 into 30May2021 he developed diarrhea, joint pain, chills, muscle pain, tiredness, dizziness and weakness. He's not sure if he had food poisoning over the weekend or what, but he has been suffering. He received his first dose on 20May2021, and the next dose wasn't due until 10Jun2021. He was reading through the literature and he sees that there are issues with immunocompromised people and all the medications that make a person immunocompromised which he is on. He has been reading the side effects and he has experienced diarrhea from hell, joint pain, he had chills, muscle pain and tiredness. He mentioned he did have some arm pain. He mentioned he didn't have anything soon, it was a little over a week. He also experienced dizziness and weakness, he felt like he lost strength or something like that. It may be coincidental and he could have gotten food poisoning or something over the weekend. Patient clarified his symptoms began on Saturday night, 29May2021 into Sunday, 30May2021. On 31May2021, his symptoms were a little milder, but then towards afternoon, his symptoms started back up. It felt like his intestines were twisting in knots and his diarrhea was back. He mentioned he had been taking Pepto Bismol and Alka-Seltzer. He confirmed the arm pain and diarrhea were still ongoing, however, the rest of his symptoms had pretty much improved. He clarified if he does too much too quick, his tiredness comes back. He felt like he was just zapped, he felt exhausted. The events did not require a visit to emergency room or physician office. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included weight: 157-158 lbs on an unspecified date. The outcome of events arm pain and diarrhea was not recovered, outcome of the other events was recovering.
