Medical history included myocardial infarction from an unknown date and unknown if ongoing. The caller stated, "Heart attack about 12 or 13 years ago." The patient also had a stent placement from an unknown date and unknown if ongoing. It was stated, "He has three stents in his arteries". Concomitant medication included acetylsalicylic acid (BABY ASPIRIN), metoprolol (METOPROLOL) and rosuvastatin (ROSUVASTATIN). The patient received first dose of COVID vaccine BNT162B2 at the age of 75 years on Jan2021 at a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. The patient's wife stated, "My husband and I, both got our second shot of Pfizer COVID Vaccine yesterday. Just late this afternoon (02Feb2021), he had a fever of 101.5 which has come down now because he took some Tylenol, had a stomach upset and chills and a little bit of body aches and headaches. Is this the normal reaction that has been with the Pfizer Vaccine?" It was stated, "I think he is feeling a lot better. He took two Tylenol and his fever has gone down to 98.7." It was further stated, "I have a sore arm and it is much better today but it is still just little tender that is the only thing I had. His arm was pretty sore yesterday as well." The wife stated, "Yesterday, just shortly after we both got the shot. We both had sore arms by the time we drove home, yesterday afternoon, 1Feb2021. My arm is slightly stiff still, just the muscle is slightly sore and I think, my husband is feeling a lot better today too, just slightly sore." The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included body temperature: 101.5 on 02Feb2021 and body temperature: 98.7 on Feb2021. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of fever (pyrexia). The outcome of the events was unknown. Information on lot number/batch number has been requested.

Labs notable for AKI w/ CR of 1.7 (baseline CR 1.0) and cholestatic liver enzyme elevation (AST 144/ALT 237/ALP 295/T bili 6.1/direct bili 4.0) and thrombocytopenia (nadir to 13). Discharged on 2/13/21. Of note, he had 2 similar admissions in June 2018 and Oct 2019 with unrevealing workup of mixed liver injury. His oxygen dropped too low to 76; Pneumonia; something with toxins; he couldn't eat or swallow; he couldn't eat or swallow; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer. This consumer reported similar events for 2 patients. This is the 1st of 2 reports. This consumer (wife) reported for a 75-year-old male patient that received his first dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE), on 31Jan2021 (at the age of 75-years-old) for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included dialysis for approximately 2.5 years, a lung problem, blood pressure. Concomitant medications included carvedilol and warfarin and other unspecified medications. The patient experienced pneumonia and died on 11Feb2021 03:00 AM. An autopsy was not performed. The cause of death was reported to be pneumonia. Clinical course was the follows the next day on 01Feb2021 at 9:30AM the patient was dressed and ready to go to dialysis. His oxygen dropped too low to 76. He wanted an ambulance called. He went into the hospital. The patient was confused, and he was not normally confused. In the hospital the physicians said he had pneumonia, but it wasn't that bad. The doctors were baffled. He also was in the hospital for something with toxins. He had a lung problem for a long time. If he didn't go to the bathroom the toxins were hitting the liver and then the toxins were going to the brain. When he was in the hospital he couldn't eat or swallow. The first day he did eat a bit, but he had dialysis in the hospital, and it knocks him out. They were giving him antibiotics IV. He couldn't swallow any of his pills. He was in there for 11 days and had not eaten. He couldn't swallow any pills. He started going to sleep and they started giving him Morphine drip at the end. They couldn't get any medicine in him because he couldn't swallow. The patient died of pneumonia, the outcome of the other adverse events was unknown. A 75-year-old male patient received the second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE) via an unspecified route of administration on 18Feb2021 14:30 (lot number was unknown as patient card was in the bedroom, he couldn't go, he was feeling so weak so he was not going up to bring that) at single dose for COVID-19 immunization. The patient medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. The patient previously received the first dose of BNT162B2 in right shoulder on an unspecified date for COVID-19 immunization and experienced little soreness in shoulder. The patient experienced severe chills, waves of chills, shaking; headache; feeling tired; nausea; feeling unwell; injection site pain; was feeling so weak; all on 18Feb2021. Event details: No treatment received. But patient visited hospital on18Feb2021 because he did have severe chills accompanied with headache, feeling tired, some nausea, there was an unwell feeling, little bit of fever was not actual fever but the injection site pain. There were waves of chills, shaking, he shook for about an hour, it went away for a while, in half an hour or 45 minutes it returned again. He never had shaking with chills in his entire life, he was surprised with the reaction, by 2:30 (19Feb2021) after 24 hours of that he was back to hundred percent again, he was recovering very nicely but he did have injection site pain in shoulder but that's not a big deal. The patient stated there are various different variants of this Covid virus, he asked if this vaccine it is been effective against every other. Patient weight was reported as about 178. The outcome of the events was recovering. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.; Sender's Comments: Linked Report(s) : US-PFIZER INC-2021293277 similar report from same reporter

Close
Received Pfizer COVID vaccine on 1/4/21 (1st dose) and 1/29/2021 (2nd dose) and developed sores with pus on his lips and difficulty swallowing around 1/20/2021 and dark red toes since receiving 2nd COVID vaccine on 1/29/2021.. Pt presented to ER on 2/1 and prescribed ceftin 500mg bi x10days (2/1-2/5), but based on lip culture that grew out MSSA, pt was switched to doxycycline 100mg po bid on 2/5/2021. Pt presented outpt clinic on 2/9 since rash got worse. Ceftin/doxy were dc'd. Allopurinol and colchicine were dc'd. Pt received prednisone burst x14days (2/9-2/23) which then got extended for another 21days. Due to lack of improvement on oral prednisone, dermatology wanted to increase prednisone and start Imuran. Pt ended up getting admitted to hospital on 3/15/2021. Pt was started on cyclosporine modified 150mg po bid and prednisone 60mg daily and got discharged on on 3/22/2021. Pt got re-admitted to hospital on 3/27/2021 for septic arthritis of R knee.
75 2021-03-30 nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain Began with general malaise, growing fatigue, then progressed over next 12 hours to nausea, vomiting,... Read more
Close
Began with general malaise, growing fatigue, then progressed over next 12 hours to nausea, vomiting, non-localized abdominal pain, low-grade fever and headache. Vomiting abated quickly, but nausea persisted through subsequent 12 hours as did malaise, fatigue and abdominal pain. During this 2nd 12 hours particularly alternate chills and sweats occurred. Symptoms largely abated after 36 hours.

IN ER, score =22, aphasic, R hemiplegic, CT scan of head showed large parenchymal hematoma in L basal ganglia with small SAH plus 2 mm L to F subfalcine midline shift. Pt was intubated in ER for airway protection after an episode of vomiting. On 15Feb2021, he had another bout of diarrhea and then also he has been feeling week. At times the hormone medicine, Lupron can cause him to be weak, but this is excessive weakness and last night excessive weakness. He is improving so he is not complaining but he thought if this could help someone else he wants to share. The patient also reported last night his hot flashes were unbelievable. He confirms the medication he takes is Lupron and he has been taking it for 7 years and it basically eliminates testosterone he is pretty much physically castrated, and he goes through menopause pretty much. He has survived prostate cancer 11 going on 12 years and he is not trying to brag but he is just trying to say he watches everything. As primary care, the patient had a urologist and a cancer doctor. nausea; muscle pain and tenderness in both legs; Sharp pain, throbbing, sore and if you pressed down on leg/tenderness in both legs; weakness in both legs from thighs to calves all the way down to ankles; sore in his legs especially the thigh and calf area, down around ankles; tiredness/Chronic fatigue has gotten a lot worse; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer(patient). A 75-year-old male patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Lot Number: EN6198, vaccine product manufacture date 24Feb2021 ) intramuscularly in arm (for route of administration: Caller stated the shoulder, caller forgot whether left or right, clarified as shoulder muscle. Caller thought it was in the left shoulder muscle but stated don't hold him to it. Caller said he was picturing himself sitting down, but didn't remember if its the right or left arm) on 17Mar2021 13:20 at age of 75-year-old at single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included fibromyalgia, chronic fatigue, two bouts with cancer, heart attack, pneumonia years ago (He said it was 3 or 4 weeks in the hospital when the caller had pneumonia, Caller clarified he was in the hospital for at least 4 weeks and home for 3 or 4 weeks, that's how bad caller's pneumonia was. Also the fact the caller is 75 years old, so basically caller's age and immune system) and a lot of health issues. Other medical history included gastritis. When relevant family medical history was queried caller said it was just like caller said, the pain was just constant. He could not take any kind of Aspirin, Advil or anything like that because caller has severe gastritis. Caller may try something topical cream to see if it would help or not. Caller stated he had Atypical Neuralgia and had not taken anything for the leg pain. Caller's stomach was extremely sensitive to any type of medication. The only medication the caller took is for blood pressure. If he took any medication it hits his gastrointestinal system, musculoskeletal and central nervous system so he didn't take any prescribed medications other than Atenolol for blood pressure, once a day. Caller took Valium as needed for severe costochondritis, stated between the ribs was cartilage, the Valium was taken as needed. No further information provided. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. Prior vaccinations included: the patient has had Prevnar 13 shots and had other, been a long time ago, had vaccinations in past for tetanus, Prevnar 13, pneumonia, normal flu shot every year that kind of stuff. Caller confirms he has not had any adverse event after a vaccination. No prior vaccinations within 4 weeks. No additional vaccines administered on same date of the Pfizer suspect. Caller stated he knew better than to have any other vaccinations. It was days before that, it was like on a Sunday, caller got an allergy shot, but they said allergy shot was not considered a vaccination. It was an allergy shot for dust, mold, histamines. Caller stated he may have skipped the allergy shot, confirmed caller did not receive the allergy shot. Shot was for mold, histamines and pollen, not a vaccination. No vaccines for flu or Pneumonia or anything else. The patient had problems a week after the first shot of the Pfizer COVID 19 vaccine, which was already reported to Safety. She had severe muscle pain, soreness and weakness in both legs from thighs to calves all the way down to ankles; not just the typical muscle pain, tiredness, nausea that lasts a day or so. On 24Mar2021, she started experiencing muscle pain and it has gotten progressively worse. She was not sure if she will get the second shot but she would beyond the 42 days; it's been about 6 weeks and didn't have an appointment with her rheumatologist until June.The patient talked to a nurse in the FDA. The nurse said there was no time limit to receive second dose Pfizer COVID Vaccine. Although, when the vaccination first came out caller was told the second dose Pfizer COVID Vaccine should be given no more than 6-8 weeks and the nurse was telling the caller the second dose could be given months later. Caller's first question, if caller decided to go the second dose Pfizer COVID Vaccine was there any time frame between doses that the caller would have to start over again with the Pfizer Covid Vaccinations. Caller received the Pfizer Covid Vaccine on 17Mar2021 and was not sure if he will get the second dose because he was experiencing a little bit of a problem and was not sure if it is related to the Pfizer Covid Vaccine dose one or not, caller stated he would get to that. He has a couple doctors appointments, so if they rule it out. Severe muscle pain and tenderness in both legs: Caller reported he was having severe muscle pain and tenderness in both legs began about a week after receiving first dose Pfizer Covid Vaccine. He knew most of the shots they say that you may experience muscle pain nausea and all that. That's basically it. Caller stated it is a throbbing, sharp pain that was 24/7 and it begun happening within a week after got the first dose Pfizer Covid Vaccine. Experiencing muscle pain in both legs, to thigh to calves to the ankles, 24/7, not coming and going. Caller stated ever since a week from 17Mar2021 this has been happening from 24Mar2021 to the date of report. Severe muscle pain, soreness, weakness in both legs. If caller bends down, he had to put his arm on something to pull himself up. Sharp pain, throbbing, sore and if you pressed down on leg, made it even worse. If the leg was touched anywhere it was just really sore and tender and kind of like a sharp pain. Sharp pain wasn't as bad as the soreness. Extremely sore and tender 24/7 and hadn't stopped since 24Mar2021. About the time period it started and hasn't let up since then. If caller did any kind of work, trying to get muscles back in shape with exercise helps, but if caller did anything putzing around and pulling weeds, bending down exacerbates the problem. Any kind of activity exacerbates the problem greatly. Caller never had this kind of muscle pain. Severe muscle pain and tenderness in both legs: Caller reported he was sore in his legs especially the thigh and calf area, down around ankles not too bad. But the thigh and the calf muscles are extremely sore and painful. Caller sated has not gotten any better, if anything may have gotten a little worse. Same or maybe a little worse, honestly, when first came on just felt like a little bit of muscle pain. Initial onset to now it has gotten worse, it hadn't gotten worse in the last few weeks. The pain was bad lets put it that way. Caller guesses the biggest thing it has a major impact on is his quality of life. Caller has gotten different surgeries and stuff and been able to move on. However, with this the caller was lucky to be able to do anything for half an hour to an hour and then he just has to sit down. Caller stated it was having a major impact on caller's quality of life. Caller like to have gone but doctor ordered blood work, didn't want caller to be exposed. Caller was holding off going to emergency room, didn't want exposure of going to the emergency room. Pain was pretty bad but not to the point of screaming out of caller's mind. Severe muscle pain and tenderness in both legs: Caller reports throbbing sharp pain in both legs. Chronic fatigue has gotten a lot worse: Caller stated he does have chronic fatigue prior to receiving the Pfizer Covid Vaccine dose one. Chronic fatigue has gotten a lot worse after receiving the first dose Pfizer Covid Vaccine. Noticed two weeks after receiving the Pfizer Covid Vaccine caller felt the chronic fatigue more. Before, caller felt tired all the time, now caller is exhausted if caller does anything for half an hour to an hour, caller has to sit down and falls asleep for awhile. Chronic fatigue has gotten worse in conjunction with leg pain. The chronic fatigue worsening began maybe a couple weeks after receiving the first dose Pfizer Covid Vaccine. Caller stated you have to have Chronic Fatigue to understand. Everyone may be tired and if you want to call it a day they may go home and feel a little tired but with Chronic fatigue sleeping 8 hours a night, REM sleep, wake up and just feel totally exhausted. Some people were worse and can't get out of bed. He can at least get out of bed but Everything is an effort to move forward with chronic fatigue. Caller's Chronic Fatigue has gotten worse since receiving the Pfizer Covid Vaccine. Whether this is related or not, caller is not in a position to say. Caller states he can report the sequence of events as they happened and let the determination be made. Chronic Fatigue has gotten considerably worse. The outcome of the events was unknown. No follow-up attempts are needed; No further information is expected.

Pain and tenderness in left shoulder (triceps) area for 5 days after shot. Pain progressively developed in left outer elbow where the triceps tendon attaches to the left lateral malleolus. Sharp pain associated with extension of left arm . Local swelling and tenderness in area of malleolus. Problem continues and is getting worse!
75 2021-06-20 difficulty swallowing, painful swallowing Patient is a very pleasant 75y.o. year old male with a known history of metastatic colon carcinoma ... Read more
Close
Patient is a very pleasant 75y.o. year old male with a known history of metastatic colon carcinoma currently receiving chemotherapy, presenting to the hospital with complaints of odynophagia and dysphagia with both liquids and solids over the past 2-3 days. Additional complaints included intermittent shortness of breath related to "asthma" - unchanged in character or severity from previously.. He denies any cough, chest pain, fever, chills, sweats. At presentation he was afebrile with stable vital signs and was maintaining an O2 sat of 100% breathing room air. Laboratory revealed a WBC of 40.4 with a predominance of neutrophils on the differential as well as toxic granulation (patient had just recently received Neulasta on 6/17), mild elevation of his alkaline phosphatase of 199 with a normal bilirubin, and normal renal function. CXR was negative for any acute pathology. For reasons that are unclear, testing for SARS CoV 2 by NAA was performed and was positive. The patient has a history of having had Covid in November 2020, and also received vaccination for Covid with 2 doses of the Pfizer vaccine in April of this year. His any recent contact with anyone with Covid 19, and states that he has severely limited travel outside of his apartment to avoid social contact during the pandemic. ID is consulted regarding the above presentation. Significance unclear. This patient has little in the way of symptomatology to support a diagnosis of Covid 19. He had symptomatic infection with SARS CoV 2 in November 2020. Prolonged positive testing for SARS CoV 2 by NAA as been noted for months following Covid 19. In addition, prolonged shedding has been noted in patient's who are immunocompromised, although I would doubt that is the situation here as he is asymptomatic for Covid 19 (intermittent shortness of breath likely related to his underlying asthma as she is maintaining an excellent O2 sat breathing room air at this time and has a negative CXR). I do not think any therapy for Covid 19 is indicated at this time. Would doubt he is shedding infectious virus, but will continue isolation for now

Updated: July 8, 2021
